original: Molin, Nils Rikard, f.rl. dr, förste bibliotekarie, Gö-teborg, f. 7/2/92 i Gbg av byggmåst. Janne M. o. Albertina Svensson. G. 31 m. fil. dr Anna Röding. Biarn: Björn f. 32, Tan 34. — Fil. mag. 17, fil. lic. 24 o. fil. dr 31, allt i Gbg. E. o. aman. v. Gbgs stadsbibi. 18, aman. där 20, andre bibliiot. 30 o. förste sed. 40. Tiiiika bibliot. v. Västra Sv: es fodkbildn : förb. 30-32. Utg.: Karl August Hagberg som översätt. (29), Shakespeare o. Sv:e Oakad. avh, 31), K. A. Hagbergs övers ättn. av Shakespeares dram. arb. i revid. uppl. 1-18 (25-29), upps. i uppslagsb., fest-skr. samt tidn. o. tidskr.
translated:
Molin, Nils Rikard, born on February 7, 1892 in Gothenburg to builder Janne M. and Albertina Svensson. Married on March 31, 19-- to Anna Röding, who holds a doctorate in philosophy. They have two children: Björn, born in 1932, and Tan, born in 1934. 

Academic achievements: Bachelor of Arts in 1917, licentiate in philosophy in 1924, and doctorate in philosophy in 1931, all completed in Gothenburg. Started working as a deputy assistant librarian at Gothenburg City Library in 1918, became an assistant librarian in 1920, second librarian in 1930, and first librarian in 1940. Served as a librarian for the Western Swedish Educational Association from 1930-1932.

Published works include translations of Karl August Hagberg (1929), dissertations on Shakespeare and the Swedish Royal Academy (1931), revised editions 1-18 of K.A. Hagberg's translation of Shakespeare's dramatic works (1925-1929), contributions to encyclopedias, commemorative publications, as well as publications in newspapers and magazines.

structured.name: Nils Rikard Molin

works.name: K. A. Hagbergs övers ättn. av Shakespeares dram. arb. i revid. uppl. 1-18

structured.description: Nils Rikard Molin was a Swedish first librarian, born on February 7, 1892, in Gothenburg. He was the son of builder Janne M. and Albertina Svensson. He married Anna Röding, a doctor of philosophy, on March 31, 19--. They had two children: Björn, born in 1932, and Tan, born in 1934. Molin completed his Bachelor of Arts degree in 1917, Licentiate in Philosophy in 1924, and Doctorate in Philosophy in 1931, all at Gothenburg University. He started his career as a deputy assistant librarian at Gothenburg City Library in 1918 and progressed to become an assistant librarian in 1920, second librarian in 1930, and first librarian in 1940. From 1930 to 1932, Molin served as a librarian for the Western Swedish Educational Association. He contributed to various publications, including translations by Karl August Hagberg, dissertations on Shakespeare, and revised editions of K.A. Hagberg's translations of Shakespeare's dramatic works.
